definition: to smooth whiskers and pat a horse's bottom (idiom); to use flatter to get what one wants/to toady/boot-licking
to slip away/to escape in stealth/to skate
to pat/to clap/to slap/to swat/to take (a photo)/to shoot (a film)/racket (sports)/beat (music)
horse/CL:匹[pi3]/horse or cavalry piece in Chinese chess/knight in Western chess
surname Ma/abbr. for Malaysia 馬來西亞|马来西亚[Ma3 lai2 xi1 ya4]

sentences.english: Mentally strong people recognize that they don't need to please everyone all the time.
sentences.chinese: 內心強大之人深知隨時溜鬚拍馬毫無必要。

sentences.english: Licking the leaders'foots is also his strong point.
sentences.chinese: 給領導溜鬚拍馬也是他的專長。

sentences.english: But the latest headlines to mention her name have not been nearly as flattering.
sentences.chinese: 但是，最近有關她的新聞頭條卻遠非溜鬚拍馬。

sentences.english: Many despise those who are always trying to win the favour of their bosses.
sentences.chinese: 非常鄙視那些總是給老闆溜鬚拍馬的人。

sentences.english: I did overpower him the way he flattered.
sentences.chinese: 我真受不了他那種溜鬚拍馬的樣子。

sentences.english: Eg : By being nice to the boss , John was working an angle to get a promotion .
sentences.chinese: 通過對老闆溜鬚拍馬，約翰想得到晉升。
